com.thetransactioncompany.cors
Class CORSConfiguration

java.lang.Object
  com.thetransactioncompany.cors.CORSConfiguration

public class CORSConfiguration
extends java.lang.Object

The CORS filter configuration (typically originating from the web application descriptor file web.xml). The fields become immutable (final) after the are initialised.

Version:
1.3.2 (2011-07-29)
Author:
Vladimir Dzhuvinov

Field Summary
 boolean allowAnyOrigin
          If true the CORS filter must allow requests from any origin, else the origin whitelist allowedOrigins must be consulted.
 java.util.Set<java.lang.String> allowedOrigins
          Whitelisted origins that the CORS filter must allow.
 boolean allowGenericHttpRequests
          If true generic HTTP requests must be allowed to pass through the filter, else only valid and accepted CORS requests must be allowed (strict CORS filtering).
 boolean allowOriginSuffixMatching
          If true the CORS filter must allow requests from any origin whose suffix matches any of the allowedOrigins.
 java.util.Set<HeaderFieldName> exposedHeaders
          The non-simple response headers that the web browser should expose to the author of the CORS request.
 int maxAge
          Indicates how long the results of a preflight request can be cached by the web client, in seconds.
 java.util.Set<HeaderFieldName> supportedHeaders
          The names of the supported author request headers.
 java.util.Set<HTTPMethod> supportedMethods
          The supported HTTP methods.
 boolean supportsCredentials
          Indicates whether user credentials, such as cookies, HTTP authentication or client-side certificates, are supported.

Field Detail

allowGenericHttpRequests

public final boolean allowGenericHttpRequests
If true generic HTTP requests must be allowed to pass through the filter, else only valid and accepted CORS requests must be allowed (strict CORS filtering).

Property key: cors.allowGenericHttpRequests

allowAnyOrigin

public final boolean allowAnyOrigin
If true the CORS filter must allow requests from any origin, else the origin whitelist allowedOrigins must be consulted.

Property key: cors.allowOrigin (set to *)

allowOriginSuffixMatching

public final boolean allowOriginSuffixMatching
If true the CORS filter must allow requests from any origin whose suffix matches any of the allowedOrigins.

Property key: cors.allowOrigin (set to *)

allowedOrigins

public final java.util.Set<java.lang.String> allowedOrigins
Whitelisted origins that the CORS filter must allow. Requests from origins not included here must be refused with a HTTP 403 "Forbidden" response. This property is overriden by allowAnyOrigin.

Note: The set is of type String instead of Origin to bypass parsing of the request origins before matching, see http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-webapps/2010JulSep/1046.html

Property key: cors.allowOrigin

supportedMethods

public final java.util.Set<HTTPMethod> supportedMethods
The supported HTTP methods. Requests for methods not included here must be refused by the CORS filter with a HTTP 405 "Method not allowed" response.

Property key: cors.supportedMethods

supportedHeaders

public final java.util.Set<HeaderFieldName> supportedHeaders
The names of the supported author request headers.

Property key: cors.supportedHeaders

exposedHeaders

public final java.util.Set<HeaderFieldName> exposedHeaders
The non-simple response headers that the web browser should expose to the author of the CORS request.

Property key: cors.exposedHeaders

supportsCredentials

public final boolean supportsCredentials
Indicates whether user credentials, such as cookies, HTTP authentication or client-side certificates, are supported.

Property key: cors.supportsCredentials

maxAge

public final int maxAge
Indicates how long the results of a preflight request can be cached by the web client, in seconds. If -1 unspecified.

Property key: cors.maxAge

Constructor Detail

CORSConfiguration

public CORSConfiguration(java.util.Properties props)
                  throws CORSConfigurationException
Creates a new CORS configuration from the specified properties.

The following properties are recognized (if missing they default to the specified values):

  • cors.allowGenericHttpRequests {true|false} defaults to true.
  • cors.allowOriginSuffixMatching {true|false} defaults to false.
  • cors.allowOrigin {"*"|origin-list} defaults to *.
  • cors.supportedMethods {method-list} defaults to "GET, POST, HEAD, OPTIONS".
  • cors.supportedHeaders {header-list} defaults to empty list.
  • cors.exposedHeaders {header-list} defaults to empty list.
  • cors.supportsCredentials {true|false} defaults to true.
  • cors.maxAge {int} defaults to -1 (unspecified).

Parameters:
props - The properties.
Throws:
CORSConfigurationException - On a invalid property.
Method Detail

isAllowedOrigin

public final boolean isAllowedOrigin(java.lang.String origin)
Helper method to check whether requests from the specified origin must be allowed. This is done by looking up allowAnyOrigin and allowedOrigins (in that order).

Parameters:
origin - The origin as reported by the web client (browser), null if unknown.
Returns:
true if the origin is allowed, else false.

originSuffixAllowed

public final boolean originSuffixAllowed(java.lang.String originString)
Helper method to check whether requests from the specified origin suffix and scheme are allowed. This is done by looking up the Origin's scheme and host name and matching with allowedOrigins but also allowing for subdomains. eg. Origin: https://foo.example.com matches cors.allowedOrigin = https://example.com whereas cors.allowedOrigin = http://example.com would not match.

Parameters:
originString - The origin as reported by the web client (browser), null if unknown.
Returns:
true if the origin suffix is allowed, else false.

isSupportedMethod

public final boolean isSupportedMethod(HTTPMethod method)
Helper method to check whether the specified HTTP method is supported. This is done by looking up supportedMethods.

Parameters:
method - The HTTP method.
Returns:
true if the method is supported, else false.

isSupportedHeader

public final boolean isSupportedHeader(HeaderFieldName header)
Helper method to check whether the specified (non-simple) author request header is supported. This is done by looking up supportedHeaders.

Parameters:
header - The header field name.
Returns:
true if the header is supported, else false.

parseWords

protected static java.lang.String[] parseWords(java.lang.String s)
Parses a string containing words separated by space and/or comma.

Parameters:
s - The string to parse.
Returns:
An array of the parsed words, empty if none were found.
